description: This is an Artisan flow definition.

meta.name: quarkus-setup
meta.description: creates project and tekton pipelines for a Quarkus Java Application

secret.name: QUARKUS_SETUP_CREATE_PROJECT_OXART_REG_USER
secret.description: the username to authenticate with the registry at artisan.library'

secret.name: QUARKUS_SETUP_CREATE_PROJECT_OXART_REG_PWD
secret.description: the password to authenticate with the registry at 'artisan.library'

var.name: PROJECT_GROUP_ID
var.description: the maven group id for the project.

var.name: PROJECT_ARTIFACT_ID
var.description: the maven artifact id for the application

var.name: PROJECT_ARTIFACT_VERSION
var.description: the version of the application artifact

steps.name: push-to-git
steps.description: initialise git repo and pushes project

secret.name: GIT_REPO_UNAME
secret.description:
git repo user name to push the code
it's used to push the code generated by the quarkus scaffold

secret.name: GIT_REPO_PWD
secret.description:
git repo password to push the code
it's used to push the code generated by the quarkus scaffold

var.name: GIT_URI
var.description:
the URI of the project git repository. create empty git project and pass that uri here.
eg. https://gitlab.com/<group-name>/<project-name>.git

var.name: GIT_REPO_EMAIL
var.description:
git user email id to push the quarkus scaffold code
email id is used to get authenticate with the code repo

secret.name: ART_REG_USER
secret.description: the user to authenticate with the Artisan Registry (used by Application publish-app function)

secret.name: ART_REG_PWD
secret.description: the password to authenticate with the Artisan Registry (used by Application publish-app function)

secret.name: SONAR_TOKEN
secret.description:
the token to access the sonar server
open sonar dashboard -> click on My Account -> Security -> Genearte new token

secret.name: PULL_IMAGE_REGISTRY_UNAME
secret.description: user name for the container registry where the base image is located

secret.name: PULL_IMAGE_REGISTRY_PWD
secret.description: password for the container registry where the base image is located

secret.name: PUSH_IMAGE_REGISTRY_UNAME
secret.description: user name for the container registry where the application image will be pushed

secret.name: PUSH_IMAGE_REGISTRY_PWD
secret.description: password for the container registry where the application image will be pushed

secret.name: REGISTRY_USER
secret.description: artefact registry user name where artefact will be pushed

secret.name: REGISTRY_PWD
secret.description: artefact registry password where artefact will be pushed

secret.name: ART_RUNNER_UNAME
secret.description: the user to authenticate with the Artisan Runner

secret.name: ART_RUNNER_PWD
secret.description: the password to authenticate with the Artisan Runner

var.name: PROJECT_ARTIFACT_ID
var.description: the maven artifact id for the application

var.name: PROJECT_ARTIFACT_VERSION
var.description: the version of the application artifact

var.name: GIT_URI
var.description:
the URI of the project git repository. create empty git project and pass that uri here.
eg. https://gitlab.com/<group-name>/<project-name>.git

var.name: SONAR_URI
var.description:
the URI of the SonarQube server to use for code quality reporting
eg. https://<host-name>

var.name: SONAR_PROJECT_KEY
var.description: the unique key identifying the project in the SonarQube server

var.name: SONAR_SOURCES
var.description: the path the sonar scanner should use to scan source code

var.name: SONAR_BINARIES
var.description: the path the sonar scanner should use to scan binary files

var.name: APP_PACKAGE_NAME
var.description:
the name:tag for the application package to be published (e.g. registry-host/app-group/app-name)
this package contains application artfacts, dockerfile & build.yaml file. it's used by image builder to build the application img

var.name: APPLICATION_NAME
var.description: the application name to create openshift tekton pipeline resources eg. EventListner & PipelineResources

var.name: PUSH_IMAGE_REGISTRY
var.description:
the image registry name (eg. registry.gitlab.com)
it's use to push application image into the image registry

var.name: PUSH_IMAGE_REPO
var.description:
the image repo name
repo name of the image registry where image to be pushed. if repo is created under user then it will be username
if it's created inside the specific group then it would be a group name

var.name: PUSH_IMAGE_NAME
var.description:
the application image name. it's a final image name that will be pushed into the img registry
we can pass any name (eg. java-app)

var.name: PUSH_IMAGE_VERSION
var.description: the application image version/tag. it's a docker image tag used to identify the img uniquely

var.name: PULL_IMAGE_REGISTRY
var.description:
application runtime image registry name (eg. registry.gitlab.com)
this is the name of the image registry where base docker image is stored. it can be redhat, gitlab or quay registry

var.name: PACKAGE_NAME
var.description:
the name:tag for the quarkus recepie package to download (e.g. registry-host/app-group/package-name)
it contains setup & pipeline flow alongwith build.yaml file
this package should be already available in the artefact registry like nexus

var.name: CRYPTO_KEY_EMAIL
var.description:
the email id which is used to generate crypto signature keys by using art cli
this email id is used by img builder to sign the application image

var.name: ART_RUNNER_URI
var.description: the URI of the Artisan runner to use

var.name: CI_NAMESPACE
var.description: the name of the openshift/kubernetes namespace where the app pipeline should be created

var.name: HOST_NAME
var.description: openshift or kubernetes cluster hostname required to deploy app & create an ingress
